name: Total lightning density
definition: Total number of detected flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

name: Turbulence
definition: 3D field of kinetic energy density of turbulent motion of the air

name: Upward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
definition: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface

name: Upward long-wave irradiance at TOA
definition: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface and the gases, aerosols and clouds ot the atmosphere at the top of the atmosphere

name: Upward short-wave irradiance at TOA
definition: Flux density of solar radiation, reflected by the Earth surface and atmosphere, emitted to space at the top of the atmosphere

name: Upward spectral radiance at TOA
definition: Upward radiant power measured at the top of the atmosphere per area unit, per solid angle, and per wavelength interval. Spectral range 0.2-200 µm. Resolving power ?/??= 1000. Accuracy quoted as SNR (Signal-to-Noise-Ratio), actually SNR^-1 so that smaller figure means better performance, as usual.

name: UV flux
definition: Integrated UV flux.

name: UV flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of diffuse UV flux measured in space.

name: UV sky image
definition: UV image of the sky

name: Vegetation type
definition: Result of the classification of different types of vegetation within a vegetated area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: VIS flux
definition: Integrated VIS flux

name: VIS flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of diffuse VIS flux measured in space

name: VIS sky image
definition: VIS image of the sky

name: Water-leaving spectral radiance
definition: Upward spectral radiance from the ocean surface, i.e. amount of light leaving the ocean per unit area, per wavelength and per solid angle.

name: Wave 1D energy frequency spectrum
definition: 1D variable colloquially referred to as “wave spectrum”. Describes the wave energy in each frequency band (e.g. 25 frequency bands) regardless of the direction of propagation

name: Wave directional energy frequency spectrum
definition: 2D variable colloquially referred to as wave spectrum. Describes the wave energy travelling in each direction and frequency band (e.g., 24 distinct azimuth sectors each 15° wide, and 25 frequency bands)

name: Wetland extent
definition: Fraction of an area flood by water

name: Wind (horizontal)
definition: 3D field of the horizontal vector component (2D) of the 3D wind vector. The acuracy is meant as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications,SPARC (deprecated),Space Weather

name: Wind (vertical)
definition: 3D field of the vertical component of the 3D wind vector
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Wind direction (near surface)
definition: Direction from which wind is blowing at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata

name: Wind gust
definition: Maximum value, over the observing cycle, of the 3-second running average wind speed

name: Wind speed (near surface)
definition: Speed of air at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-OOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Wind stress
definition: The shear force per unit area exerted by wind blowing over the sea surface -

name: Wind vector (near surface)
definition: Horizontal wind vector, at a known height above the surface which is to be sprcified in the metadata
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),CLIVAR (deprecated),Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Climate-OOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: X-ray flux
definition: Integrated X-ray flux.

name: X-ray flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the integrated X-ray flux.

name: X-ray sky image
definition: X-ray image of the sky

name: HDO
definition: 3D field of amount  of HDO (Water vapour (with one hydrogen nucleus replaced by its deuterium isotope) , expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Heavy ion angular flux energy and mass spectrum
definition: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron, per unit solid angle

name: Heavy ion differential directional flux
definition: Flux density of heavy ions (eavier than Helium) per unit solid angle

name: Heavy ion flux energy and mass spectrum
definition: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

name: Heavy ion integral directional flux
definition: Flux density of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

name: Height of the top of PBL
definition: Height of the surface separating the PBL from the free atmosphere

name: Height of the tropopause
definition: Height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

name: Heliospheric image
definition: Image of the interplanetary space between the Sun and Earth

name: hmF2
definition: Altitude of the peak density in the ionospheric F2 layer.

name: HNO3
definition: 3D field of amount of HNO<sub>3</sub> (Nitric acid, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Hydrometeor type
definition: 3D field of the predominant form of condensed water in a volume of free atmosphere, including liquid cloud, rain, ice crystals, snow, graupel and hail. (This variable replaces "precipitation type").

name: Ice sheet topography
definition: Map of ice sheet height over land .

name: Icing potential
definition: 3D field of super-cooled liquid water, enabling the formation of ice coating on an object.

name: Integrated Water Vapour (IWV)
definition: Total amount of water vapour present in a vertical atmospheric column.
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Interplanetary magnetic field
definition: Vector magnetic field (3D) in the solar wind. The reference frame is Cartesian or Cylindrical with many different axis orientations. Important in Space Weather to monitor magnetic disturbances of the near earth environment.

name: Ionospheric plasma density
definition: Total number of ionized particles in a volume unit of ionospheric plasma

name: Ionospheric plasma velocity
definition: Velocity of bulk plasma or electrons (depending on measurement technique) as a function of altitude in the ionosphere.

name: Ionospheric Radio Absorption
definition: Attenuation of a radio wave passing through the lower ionosphere.

name: Ionospheric Scintillation
definition: Random fluctuations of radio waves resulting of small scale variations of the ionospheric electron density in space and time.

name: Ionospheric Vertical Total Electron Content (VTEC)
definition: Number of electrons between two points.

name: Lake area
definition: Aera extent of the surface of a lake

name: Lake level
definition: Map of the height of the lake surface.

name: Lake Surface Temperature
definition: Temperature of the lake surface - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

name: Land cover
definition: Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

name: Land surface temperature
definition: Temperature of the apparent surface of land (bare soil or vegetation) - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Land surface topography
definition: Map of land surface heights - Physical unit: [ m ] - Accuracy unit: [ m ].

name: Leaf Area Index (LAI)
definition: LAI is the total one-sided area of photosynthetic tissue per unit ground surface area
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-TOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology

name: Long-wave Earth surface emissivity
definition: Emissivity of the Earth surface in the thermal IR, function of the wavelength

name: Melting layer depth in clouds
definition: Depth of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

name: Meteorological Optical Range (MOR) (surface)
definition:
Length of path in the atmosphere required to reduce the luminous flux in a collimated beam from an incandescent lamp, at a colour temperature of 2 700 K, to 5 per cent of its original value, the luminous flux being evaluated by means of the photometric luminosity function of the International Commission on Illumination.  For aeronautical purposes, the surface MOR is measured at a height of 2.5 m above the surface. 
(Unit: m )

name: N(15)NO Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta N-15 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

name: N(15)NO-Alpha Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Alpha-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the outer Nitrogen atom is N-15)  (isotopic signature)

name: N(15)NO-Beta Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Beta-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the middle Nitrogen atom is N-15) (isotopic signature)

name: N2(18)O Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta O-18 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

name: N2O mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount  of N<sub>2</sub>O (Nitrous oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: N2O mole fraction (BG)
definition: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) N2O (Nitrous Oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: N2O mole fraction (SR)
definition: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) N2O (Nitrous Oxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: N2O5
definition: 3D field of amount of N2O5 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NH3 Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of  NH3 (Ammonia, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NH3 Total Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of NH3 molecules (Ammonia) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: NIR/SWIR flux
definition: Integrated NIR/SWIR flux

name: NIR/SWIR flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of diffuse NIR/SWIR flux measured in space

name: NIR/SWIR sky image
definition: NIR/SWIR image of the sky

name: NO
definition: 3D field of amount of NO expressed in moles divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2  Total Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: NO2 Mole  fraction (SR)
definition: 3D field of amount of Source Region (SR) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2 mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of NO<sub>2</sub> (Nitrogen dioxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: NO2 Mole fraction (BG)
definition: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: NO2 mole fraction (near surface)
definition: 2D field of amount of NO2 (Nitrogen Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: NO2 Stratospheric Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules (Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the tropopause to the stratopause
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: C5H8
definition: 3D field of amountof C<sub>5</sub>H<sub>8</sub> (Isoprene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C6H6
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>6</sub> (Benzene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C7H8 Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>8</sub> (Toluene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CFC-11
definition: 3D field of amount of CFC-11 (Trichlorofluoromethane = Freon-11,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CFC-12
definition: 3D field of amount of CFC-12 (Dichlorodifluoromethane = Freon-12, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

name: CH3Br
definition: 3D field of amount of CH<sub>3</sub>Br (methil bromide, or bromomethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH3CN Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of CH<sub>3</sub>CN (Acetonitrile, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH3D Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

name: CH3OH Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of CH<sub>3</sub>OH (Methanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: CH4 column average dry air mixing ratio
definition: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CH4, methane) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CH4 mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of CH4 (Methane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CH4 Mole fraction (BG)
definition: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CH4 Mole fraction (SR)
definition: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CH4 Tropospheric column
definition: 2D field of total amount of CH4 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: ClO
definition: 3D field of amount  of ClO (Chlorine monoxide = Hypochlorite, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: ClONO2
definition: 3D field of amount of ClONO<sub>2</sub> (Chlorine nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Cloud base height
definition: Height of the bottom surface of the cloud
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Cloud cover
definition: 3D field of fraction of sky filled by clouds.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: Cloud drop effective radius
definition: Size distribution of liquid water drops, assimilated to spheres of the same volume. Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Global NWP,High Res NWP

name: Cloud ice
definition: 3D field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not).

name: Cloud ice effective radius
definition: Size distribution of ice particles, assimilated to spheres of the same volume.  Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface

name: Cloud ice Total Column
definition: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

name: Cloud liquid water (CLW)
definition: 3D field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP

name: Cloud liquid water (CLW) total column
definition: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

name: Cloud optical depth
definition: Effective depth of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation extinction. OD = exp(-K.Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ], Δz the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud and the reference wavelength to be specified in the metadata.

name: Cloud to Ground lightning density
definition: Number of detected cloud-to-ground flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

name: Cloud top height
definition: Height of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

name: Cloud top pressure
definition: Pressure at the top of the cloud

name: Cloud top temperature
definition: Temperature of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

name: Cloud type
definition: Result of cloud type classification - Accuracy expressed as inverse of number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: CO mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CO mole fraction (near surface)
definition: 2D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CO Total Column
definition: 2D field of total number of CO modelcues (Carbon Monixide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth's  surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: CO Tropospheric column
definition: 2D field of total amount of CO molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: CO2 column average dry air mixing ratio
definition: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CO2, Carbon dioxide) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CO2 flux
definition: Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere

name: CO2 mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of CO2 (Carbon dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: CO2 Mole fraction (BG)
definition: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO2 Mole fraction (SR)
definition: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: CO2 Tropospheric Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of CO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

name: Coastal sea level (tide)
definition: Deviation of sea level from local references in coastal zones, caused by local currents and tides (astronomical and wind-induced).

name: Coastlines
definition: Location of coastlines  (Lat/Long)

name: Colour Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM)
definition: Optically measurable component of the dissolved organic matter in water.

name: COS
definition: 3-D field of amount  of COS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Cosmic ray neutron flux
definition: Flux of neutrons near the surface of Earth due to collisions in the atmosphere of cosmic rays impacting Earth atmosphere from the Sun and outer space.

name: Cosmic ray neutron flux spectrum
definition: Flux density energy spectrum of neutrons from the Sun or as component of the cosmic radiation.

name: Crustal motion (horizontal and vertical)
definition: Changes in time of the position and height of the Earth plates.  Indicative of the lithosphere dynamics, thus useful for earthquake prediction  - Physical unit: [ mm/y ] - Accuracy unit: [ mm/y ].

name: Crustal plates positioning
definition: Basis for monitoring the evolution of the lithosphere dynamics - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Dew Point Temperature
definition: Temperature to which air must be cooled to become saturated with water vapor  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata (K)

name: Dissolved inorganic carbon  (DIC)
definition: The cumulated concentration of inorganic carbon species (dissolved carbon dioxide, carbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate) in solution.

name: NO2 Tropospheric column
definition: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules ( Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: NO3 Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of NO3 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)
definition: Difference between maximum (in NIR) and minimum (around the Red) vegetation reflectance, normalised to the summation.  Representative of total biomass, supportive for computing LAI if not directly measured
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: O3
definition: 3D field of amount of O3 (Ozone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles).
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,SPARC (deprecated)

name: O3 mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of O<sub>3</sub> (Ozone, expressed in moles) in the troposphere divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: O3 Stratospheric Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from tropopause to stratopause

name: O3 Total Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of O3 molecules per unit area  in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere (Dobson units).
required for application: Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Global NWP,High Res NWP,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: O3 Tropospheric Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the to the tropopause

name: Ocean chlorophyll concentration
definition: Indicator of living phytoplankton biomass, extracted from ocean colour observation. Uncertainty is expressed in mg/m<sup>3</sup> for a given concentration of 1 mg/m<sup>3</sup> .

name: Ocean Diffuse Attenuation Coefficient (DAC)
definition: Indicator of water turbidity and vertical processes in the ocean, extracted from ocean colour observation.

name: Ocean dynamic topography
definition: Deviation of sea level from the geoid caused by ocean currents (after corrections for tides and atmospheric pressure effects) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Ocean salinity
definition: 3D field of salinity of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean - Physical unit: [ psu ], Practical Salinity Unit, close to 1

name: Ocean subsurface dissolved oxygen concentration
definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen

name: Ocean subsurface tracers
definition: Concentration of trace molecules such as tritium and CFCs

name: Ocean surface currents (vector)
definition: Water flow on ocean surface - Physical unit: [ cm/s ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm/s ] intended as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

name: Ocean suspended sediments concentration
definition: Variable extracted from ocean colour observation. Indicative of river outflow, re-suspension or pollution of other-than-biological origin. Uncertainty expressed in g/m<sup>3</sup> at a specific concentration (e.g., 2 g/m<sup>3</sup> ).

name: Ocean temperature
definition: 3D field of temperature of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean.

name: Ocean velocity
definition: Ocean motion measured at various depth levels.

name: OCS Mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of OCS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: OH
definition: 3D field of amount of OH (Hydroxil radical, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Oil spill cover
definition: Fraction of an ocean area polluted by hydrocarbons released from ships or off-shore platforms, accidentally or deliberately.

name: PAN
definition: 3D field of amount of PAN (Peroxy Acetyl Nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: pCO2
definition: Partial pressure of carbon dioxide at the surface of the sea

name: pH
definition: The hydrogen ion concentration in seawater, which is a measure of acidity and alkalinity

name: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR)
definition: Flux of downwelling photons of wavelength 0.4-0.7

name: Precipitation  (liquid or solid)
definition: 3D field of the vertical flux of precipitating water mass (precipitation intensity)

name: Precipitation intensity at surface (liquid or solid)
definition: Intensity of precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (if solid, mm/h of liquid water after melting) - Accuracy unit: [ mm/h ]. Since accuracy changes with intensity, it is necessary to specify a reference intensity. Assumed rate: 5 mm/h.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: Precipitation intensity at surface (solid)
definition: Intensity of solid precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (mm of liquid water after melting)
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Precipitation type at the surface
definition: The type of precipitation reaching the surface, including snow, rain, hail, dew, rime, hoar frost and fog precipitation.

name: Proton differential directional flux
definition: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

name: Proton integral directional flux
definition: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: PSC occurrence
definition: 3D field of Polar Stratospheric Clouds occurrence. - Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].  Simplified: [ FAR/HR]

name: Radiation Dose Rate
definition: 3D field of the dose rate of energetic particles

name: Radiation profile
definition: Vertical profile of upward and downward LW and SW radiation components

name: Radio-waves
definition: Travelling radio-waves of solar, galactic and extragalactic origin, entering the Earth’s environment.

name: Relative humidity
definition: 3D field of relative humidity in the atmosphere. Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respct to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

name: Relative Humidity (near surface)
definition: Relative  humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata.Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respect to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

name: River discharge
definition: Volume of water flowing through a river per unit of time

name: Sea surface heat flux
definition: Sea Surface Heat Flux

name: Sea surface height anomaly
definition: Sea surface height anomaly

name: Sea Surface Mass Flux
definition: Sea Surface Mass Flux

name: Sea surface salinity
definition: Salinity of sea water in the surface layer (upper ~ 1 m if observed in MW).  In the open ocean the correct term should be  “halinity” with reference of the diversity of salts involved.

name: Sea surface temperature
definition: Temperature of the sea water at surface.   The “bulk” temperature refers to the depth of typically 2 m, the “skin” temperature refers to within the upper 1 mm.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),CLIVAR (deprecated),Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Climate-OOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications,SIAF (deprecated),SSLP

name: Sea-ice cover
definition: Fraction of an ocean area where ice is present
required for application: CLIC (deprecated),CLIVAR (deprecated),Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-OOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: Sea-ice elevation
definition: Elevation of the surface of the sea-ice sheet above sea level

name: Sea-ice motion
definition: Sea-ice motion

name: Sea-ice surface characteristics
definition: Sea-ice surface characteristics (albedo, meltpond, dust, snow properties, temperature)

name: Sea-ice surface temperature
definition: Temperature of the surface of sea-ice.

name: Sea-ice thickness
definition: Thickness of the ice sheet. It is related to sea-ice elevation and ice density
required for application: CLIC (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-OOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Ocean Applications

name: Sea-ice type
definition: Variable convolving several factors (age, roughness, density, etc.) - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes^-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

name: SF6
definition: 3D field of amount  of SF6 (Sulfur hexafluoride,   expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: Short-wave cloud reflectance
definition: Reflectance of the solar radiation from clouds

name: Significant wave height
definition: Average amplitude of the highest 30 of 100 waves.
required for application: Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Ocean Applications

name: Snow cover
definition: Fraction of a given area which is covered by snow
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Climate-TOPC (deprecated),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,Nowcasting / VSRF

name: Snow depth
definition: Vertical distance from the snow surface to the underlying surface (ground, glacier ice or sea ice).

name: Snow status (wet/dry)
definition: Binary product (dry or melting/thawing) expressing the presence of liquid water in a snow layer- Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].

name: Snow water equivalent
definition: Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained by melting a snow layer.  Linked to snow depth through the density of the snow layer.
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,SIAF (deprecated),SSLP

name: SO2 mole fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of SO<sub>2</sub> (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: SO2 mole fraction (near surface)
definition: 2D field of amount of SO<sub>2</sub> (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: SO2 Total Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules (Sulfur dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: SO2 Tropospheric Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition

name: Soil moisture  (in the roots region)
definition: Sub-soil 3D field of the fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Requested from surface down to ~ 3 m

name: Soil moisture at surface
definition: Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres)
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-TOPC (deprecated),GEWEX (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Hydrology,Nowcasting / VSRF,SIAF (deprecated),SSLP

name: Soil temperature
definition:
The standard depths for soil temperature measurements
are 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 cm below the
surface; additional depths may be included. The
site for such measurements should be a level plot of
bare ground (about 75 cm^2 ) and typical of the
surrounding soil for which information is required.

name: Soil type
definition: Result of the classification of different types of soil within an area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

name: Solar Ca II-K image
definition: Image of the Sun in the K-line of Ca-II  (393.4 nm)

name: Solar coronagraphic image
definition: Image of the solar corona surrounding the Sun.

name: Solar electric field
definition: Map of magnitude and direction of the electric field at the solar surface (photosphere).

name: Solar EUV flux
definition: Integrated EUV flux over the solar disk

name: Solar EUV flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the EUV flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar EUV image
definition: Images of the Sun in the Extreme Ultra-Violet (EUV) wavelengths in order to identify features such as filaments, active regions and coronal holes.

name: Solar gamma-ray flux
definition: Integrated gamma-ray flux over the solar disk

name: Solar gamma-ray flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the gamma-ray flux integrated over the solar disk

name: Solar H-alpha image
definition: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen-alpha transition wavelength (656.3 nm).

name: Solar Lyman-alpha flux
definition: Solar flux in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

name: Solar Lyman-alpha image
definition: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

name: Solar magnetic field
definition: Vector magnetic field (1D or 3D) at the solar surface (photosphere/chromosphere)

name: Solar radio flux
definition: Integrated radio flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar radio flux spectrum
definition: Solar radio flux energy spectrum integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar radio image
definition: 2D image of the solar radio flux

name: Solar spectral irradiance
definition: Total Solar Irradiance (TSI); when measured as a function of wavelength it is the spectral irradiance

name: Solar UV flux
definition: Integrated UV flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar UV flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the UV flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar UV image
definition: Images of the Sun in the UV wavelengths.

name: Solar velocity fields
definition: Map of 3D velocity of particles of the Solar atmosphere, significant of the Sun interior.

name: Solar VIS flux
definition: Integrated VIS flux over the solar disk

name: Solar VIS flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the integrated VIS flux over the solar disk.

name: Solar VIS image
definition: Images of the Sun in the VIS wavelengths.

name: Solar white light image
definition: Image of the Sun in white light

name: Solar wind density
definition: Density of solar wind plasma

name: Solar wind temperature
definition: Temperature of solar wind protons

name: Solar wind velocity
definition: Vector velocity of solar wind plasma

name: Solar X-ray flux
definition: Integrated X-ray flux over the solar disk

name: Solar X-ray flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the X-ray flux integrated over the solar disk.

name: Solar X-ray image
definition: Image of the Sun in X-ray wavelengths

name: Specific humidity
definition: 3D field of the specific humidity in the atmosphere. The specific humidity is the ratio between the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Atmospheric Chemistry (deprecated),Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,SPARC (deprecated)

name: Spread F
definition: Vertical thickness of highly structured ion density in the F-region of the ionosphere.

name: Temperature of the tropopause
definition: Atmospheric temperature at the height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

name: Total alkalinity (AT)
definition: The amount of acid necessary to titrate all weak bases in seawater.

name: (13)CH4 delta
definition: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature). Isotopic ratio, expressed as deviations from an agreed-upon international reference measurement standard (which defines the corresponding isotope scales) using the delta notation: δ = (R<sub>sample</sub>/R<sub>reference</sub> – 1), with R = [rare isotope]/[abundant isotope].

name: (13)CO Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

name: (13)CO2 Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: (14)CH4 Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

name: (14)CO Number Concentration
definition: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide) with C-14 isotope (mol) per air volume (m3)

name: (14)CO2 Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: Accumulated precipitation (over 24 h)
definition: Integration of precipitation rate reaching the ground over several time intervals. The reference requirement refers to integration over 24 h

name: Aerosol Absorption Optical Depth
definition: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol absorption coefficient: AAOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the absorption coefficient [km<sup>-1</sup>] and Δz the vertical path [km]

name: Aerosol column burden
definition: 2D field of the column burden of condensed particles in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol dust concentration
definition: 3-D field of concentration of dust or sand in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol effective radius
definition: 3D field of mean aerosol particle size, defined as the ratio of the third and second moments of the number size distribution of aerosol particles.  Requested in the troposphere (assumed height: 12 km) and as columnar average.

name: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
definition: 3D field of spectral volumetric extinction cross-section of aerosol particles.

name: Aerosol Layer Height
definition: Height of vertically localized aerosol layer in the free troposphere above sea level

name: Aerosol mass mixing ratio
definition: 3D field of the mass mixing ratio of condensed particles in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol Optical Depth
definition: The AOD is the effective depth of the aerosol column from the viewpoint of radiation propagation: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol extinction coefficient AOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km<sup>-1</sup> ] and Δz the vertical path [km]

name: Aerosol single-scattering albedo
definition: The spectrally dependent ratio of the aerosol scattering to the aerosol extinction

name: Aerosol species mole fraction
definition: 3D field of the mole fraction of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon),  in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol species total column burden
definition: 2D field integrated over the total column burden of concentration of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon), in the atmosphere

name: Aerosol type
definition: Selection, out of a pre-defined set of aerosol classes, that best fits an input data set (observed or modeled). The pre-defined set of aerosol classes includes specification of the particle composition, mixing state, complex refractive index, and shape as a function of particle size. The definition of aerosol type includes specification of all the classes as well as the algorithm used to choose the best fit to the input data.

name: Aerosol volcanic ash
definition: 3D field of mass mixing ratio of volcanic ash

name: Aerosol volcanic ash  Total Column
definition: 2D Field of mass of volcanic ash, integrated over the total column.

name: Air pressure (near surface)
definition: Air pressure at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Ocean Applications

name: Air specific humidity (near surface)
definition: Air specific humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata. Specific  humidity is the ratio of the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Ocean Applications

name: Air temperature (near surface)
definition: Air temperature at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,CLIC (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: Alpha particles integral directional flux
definition: An alpha particle has positive charge and consists of two protons and two neutrons (the nucleus of a helium atom). Flux is the rate of flow through a reference surface, measured in particles per unit area.The directional flux is the flux limited to a certain solid angle as a function of the direction (pitch angle).

name: Atmospheric density
definition: 3D field of density of the atmosphere

name: Atmospheric temperature
definition: 3D field of the atmospheric temperature
required for application: Aeronautical Meteorology,Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Modelling Research (deprecated),Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-AOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,SPARC (deprecated),Space Weather

name: Aurora
definition: Occurence of fluorescence of the upper atmosphere through ionization by energetic charged particles accelerated by the Earth's magnetic field.

name: Background Luminance (surface)
definition: Luminous flux received from the background, per unit solid angle and per unit area where the Luminous flux is a quantity derived from radiant flux by evaluating the radiation according to its action upon the International Commission on Illumination standard photometric observer. (symbol: L; unit: lm. m<sup>–2<sub>.</sub></sup> sr<sup>–1</sup> = cd . m<sup>–2</sup> )

name: Biomass
definition: Total amount of vegetation in a reference area - Physical unit: [ t/ha (tons/hectare) ] - Accuracy unit: [ t/ha ]

name: BrO
definition: 3D field of amount of BrO (Bromine monoxide, expressed in moles)   divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C(17)OO Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta O-17 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C(18)O Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C(18)OO Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

name: C10H16 (3-Carene) Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount  of C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> (3-Carene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C10H16 (alfapinene) Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount  of C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> (alfapinene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C10H16 (betapinene) Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> (betapinene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C10H16 (Limonene) Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> (Limonene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C2H2
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> (Acetylene. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles)

name: C2H5OH Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>5</sub>OH (Ethanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C2H6
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub> (Ethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C2H6S Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub>S (Dimethyl sulphide, DMS, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

name: C3H6O Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount  of C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>6</sub>O (Acetone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C3H8
definition: 3D field of amount  of C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub> (Propane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C4H10
definition: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>10</sub> (Methylpropane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C4H10 (n-butane)
definition: 3D field of amount dry of C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>10</sub> (n-butane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: C5H12 (2-Methylbutane)
definition: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C<sub>5</sub>H<sub>12</sub> (2-Methylbutane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: C5H12 (n-Pentane)
definition: 3D field of amount of C<sub>5</sub>H<sub>12</sub> (n-Pentane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: DMS Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of DMS (Dimethyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Dominant wave direction
definition: One feature of the ocean wave spectrum. It is the direction of the most energetic wave in the spectrum - Physical unit: [ degrees ] - Accuracy unit: [ degrees ].

name: Dominant wave period
definition: The period of the most energetic wave in the ocean wave spectrum.
required for application: Global NWP,High Res NWP,Nowcasting / VSRF,Ocean Applications

name: Downward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
definition: Flux density of radiation emitted by the gases, aerosols and clouds of the atmosphere to the Earth's surface

name: Downward short-wave irradiance at Earth surface
definition: Flux density of the solar radiation at the Earth surface

name: Downward short-wave irradiance at TOA
definition: Flux density of the solar radiation at the top of the atmosphere

name: Earth Rotation
definition: Rotation velocity of the Earth, determining the length of the day - Physical unit: [Rad/s] - Accuracy unit: [Arcsec/century].

name: Earth surface albedo
definition: Hemispherically integrated reflectance of the Earth surface in the range 0.4-0.7

name: Earth surface short-wave bidirectional reflectance
definition: Reflectance of the Earth surface as a function of the viewing angle and the illumination angle in the range 0.4-0.7 . The distribution of this variable is represented by the Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF)

name: Electric Field
definition: Magnitude and direction of the Earth’s electric field

name: Electron Density
definition: 3-D field of the electron density in the ionosphere

name: Electron differential directional flux
definition: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle

name: Electron flux density
definition: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: Electron flux energy spectrum
definition: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

name: Electron integral directional flux
definition: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

name: Electrostatic charge
definition: Measurement of the electrostatic charge of a satellite accumulated because of the environmental situation.

name: Energetic Neutral Atom (ENA)
definition: Neutral atoms resulting from the capture of free electrons by positively ionized nuclei of the solar wind.  Once neutralised, the particles are no longer deviated by the interplanetary magnetic field, and still move very fast, travelling in an exact straight line.

name: EUV flux
definition: Radiative flux integrated over the EUV band.

name: EUV flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the EUV band.

name: EUV sky image
definition: EUV image of the sky

name: Evapotranspiration
definition:
Quantity of water evaporated from
the soil and plants when the ground is at its natural moisture content.

name: Fire fractional cover
definition: Fraction of a land area where fire is occurring

name: Fire radiative power
definition: Power radiated by the fire occurring within an area

name: Fire temperature
definition: Temperature of the fire occurring within an area

name: foEs
definition: The highest ordinary-wave frequency reflected back from a sporadic E layer and observed by an ionosonde.

name: foF2
definition: Critical frequency of the F2 layer of the ionosphere. This critical frequency (f, in MHz) is associated with the electron density (Ne, in cm<sup>-3</sup>): f=9*10<sup>-3</sup>*sqrt(Ne).

name: Fraction of Absorbed PAR (FAPAR)
definition: Fraction of PAR absorbed by vegetation (land or marine) for photosynthesis processes (generally around the 'red' )
required for application: Agricultural Meteorology,Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Climate-TOPC (deprecated),Global NWP,High Res NWP,SIAF (deprecated),SSLP

name: Fraction of vegetated land
definition: Fraction of a land area where vegetation is present

name: Freezing level height in clouds
definition: Height of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

name: Gamma-ray flux
definition: Radiative flux integrated over the gamma-ray domain.

name: Gamma-ray flux spectrum
definition: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the gamma-ray domain.

name: Geoid
definition: Equipotential surface which would coincide exactly with the mean ocean surface of the Earth, if the oceans were in equilibrium, at rest, and extended through the continents (such as with very narrow channels) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

name: Geomagnetic field
definition: Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).

name: Glacier cover
definition: Fraction of a land area covered by permanent ice

name: Glacier motion
definition: Velocity of the ice measured at the surface of a glacier

name: Glacier topography
definition: Map of the height of the glacier surface.

name: Glyoxal Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of OCHCHO (Glyoxal, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Glyoxal Tropospheric column
definition: 2D field of tropospheric column averaged of amount of Glyoxal (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: Gravity field
definition: Indicative of the statics and dynamics of the lithosphere and the mantle - Physical unit: [ mGal ] where : 1 Gal = 0.01 m.s<sup>-2</sup>

name: Gravity gradients
definition: Gradient of the Earth’s gravity field measured at the satellite orbital height - Physical unit: [ E ] , Eötvös (1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km) - Accuracy unit: [ E ].

name: Ground water
definition: Amount of water present beneath the ground surface per unit area

name: h'F
definition: Virtual height of the bottom of the ionospheric F-layer.

name: H2 Mole Fraction
definition: 3D field of amount of H2 ( expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: H2O
definition: 3D field of amount of H<sub>2</sub>O (Water vapour intended as a chemical species relevant for atmospheric chemistry. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: HCFC-22
definition: 3D field of amount of HCFC-22 (hydrochlorofluorocarbon-22, or R-22expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

name: HCHO mole fraction
definition: 2D field of amount of HCHO (Formaldehyde, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata
required for application: Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: HCHO Total Column
definition: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

name: HCHO Tropospheric column
definition: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.
required for application: Climate Monitoring (GCOS),Forecasting Atmospheric Composition,Monitoring Atmospheric Composition,Providing Atmospheric Composition information  to support services in urban and populated areas

name: HCl
definition: 3D field of amount of HCl (Hydrogen chloride, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

name: HD Delta
definition: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in HD (molecular Hydrogen) (isotopic signature)
